meanings.definition: Lamest (adjective): the superlative form of lame, meaning the least impressive or exciting
meanings.sent1: The movie we watched last night was the lamest one I've ever seen.
meanings.sent2: That roller coaster was the lamest ride in the amusement park.
meanings.sent3: The party was so lamest that even the balloons seemed bored.
meanings.sent4: His excuse for being late was the lamest attempt at creativity.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance was the lamest magic show imaginable.

meanings.definition: Lamest (noun): the superlative form of lame, referring to the least impressive or exciting thing
meanings.sent1: Among all the gifts, the handmade card was the lamest.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy in the box of toys was the lamest of them all.
meanings.sent3: The race for the slowest turtle was won by the lamest one.
meanings.sent4: In the collection of paintings, the one with just a dot was the lamest.
meanings.sent5: The joke he told was the lamest of all jokes ever heard.
